number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 18, 2014
												Tl;dr Some fun and interesting mechanics built over a competent shooter, sadly too short for it's own good but definitely worth the money.When I bought this game it was for $0.54 and I have to be honest I went in expecting to laugh at it... but I'll be damned if it didn't impress me. At first the voice acting (particularly the strange almost-but-not-quite-scottish accent on the main character) and some of the character animation had me convinced I was in for one of those games that's so bad it's good but this is actually a very competently done cover-based shooter with some neat core mechanics and interesting ideas. Firstly there's a kind of batman-esque vision device you can use to track your objective or interface with camera's and doors but it also let's you see digital graffiti and you need it to find some secrets, it was pretty well done and fit into the game well. With a title like hydrophobia you can expect to be doing a lot of swimming but the water gets used as more than another way to get around, you can open doors or shoot out glass to knock over or even drown enemies, you can shoot out bulkheads to make platforming easier or put out fires and there's a bit later in the game (far too late for my liking, you only get to play with it for about a half hour tops and that's if you waste time looking for secrets and dying to the boss) where you even get a small amount of telekinetic control over it. Sadly the game ends just as it hits its stride and with a fairly unsatisfactory conclusion, nothing really gets resolved... like at all, your character falls unconscious when you beat the boss and it cuts to credits.I only have a few minor gripes, for instance I dislike how you use "ctrl" to swim faster and "shift" to descend quickly while on land "ctrl" is crouch and "shift" is sprint. Also sometimes the climbing felt a little clunky and she refused to get in cover once or twice but it's still about as good as any of the recent tomb raider games so that's just nitpicking. Honestly you'll rarely need to use your other ammo types. The starting ammo is unlimited and has a charge shot that knocks most enemies out in one headshot while everything except the explosive jelly/electroshock bullets take far more. The score system isn't really neessary in my opinion, though it is kind of satisfying to get a chain reaction shot off and see your score rocket. Oh, using your environment is a big deal here, you're highly encouraged to shoot just about everything to get an environmental kill but the focus on that means you're literally wading through roomfulls of explosive barrels which can get kind of hairy. The story was okay, the actual plot wasn't anything all that new and it felt very rushed, things get introduced to you very quickly with little in the way of background explanation, but the villains point of view was interesting, a bit bioshock-esque except less subtle, they literally quote the guy they take after in their digital graffiti. I have to give serious respect to the dev though for having a way to give feedback in the main menu even if it is a little crude, more people should do things like that.EDIT: I forgot to mention that the checkpoints can be a little unforgiving at times, it could have done with a few more. There's one climbing section near the end where the object you're climbing shifts and knocks your character off without warning and I was too far over to grab hold again so I died, then it spawned me between four rather tough enemies.All things considered I would still have been happy with the experience if I'd payed full price and that's more than I can say for a lot of games, definitely pick this up if you want something fresh and interesting without a big time commitment. There's some replay value to try and beat your high score and do some challenge maps (which let you play with that woefully underused hydrokinetic ability) if you're into that kind of thing but you probably won't get more than ten hours out of it tops. If there were a sequel I would definitely buy it too, the mechanics need more room to flex and while the story is kind of "meh" I genuinely liked the support character, he made a couple references that actually got a laugh out of me and I want to find out what happened to him.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												This game I would call more of a Show piece. yes the game is serviceable but its main focus is showing off the engine. The weapon your given has unlimited ammo as long as you charge it as the first ammo type you get and personaly I dont have a need for the other 4 types of ammo  with targets down in 1 or 2 shots. The story is borderline a Tom Clancy game, Everything is peaceful, terrorist f*** things up and you need to fix it. Though all this the main character actually just feels like her role before all the issues hit. She isnt a sharp shooter and on normal she is very weak, she feels and plays like a regular person(besides her ability to hold her breath). Control wise this game is almost poor. Walking and swiming feel clunky and if the water isnt deep enough to swim over but still too deep to walk around you get some intresting bugs. This game has a stealth system but if the water gets too deep you make a moan and alert everyone near by. so far the game preformed decent until Act 3. Act 3 i had my mouse not respond 3 times in a row from an awkward bug i got while swiming and aiming. Overall the game looks nice, i just wish the combat and movement were a little less clunky so I could enjoy it. Now here is my biggest issue, at the time of writing this I am 2.2hrs in and the game is ALMOST OVER. luckly I got this on sale and didnt pay the $5 (I think this is still $15 or $20 on Xbox). So beware this game is EXTREAMLY SHORT and your in for about a 3hr story and a challage room(which I havent tried yet). But if your a Developer looking for an engie to handle water physics this is wonderful engie to use and should give this a shot.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2012
												A phenomenal game. Hydrophobia is a great game just with the water physics alone. Since the game revolves around that it easy to see why the gameplay is so good. Only complaint is the voice acting, which was rather poor and some specific instructions are not really explained in depth (until the end, which by then you have learned yourself). Also a lot of the good content is in the 3rd act (which is the finial act). The game is about 3 ~ 4 hours long and keeps you wanting to play it. Got it for $1.50 on midweek madness but it's only $5 normally. It's defiantly an underrated game. Would love to see a sequel.-=Scoring=-Gameplay 9/10Story: 7/10Creativity: 10/10 (Puzzles and stuff)Uniqueness: 10/10 (Compared to other games)Voice Acting: 5/10Instructions: 7/10Graphics 8/10 (The character models are average but the environment is great)Overall about a 7.5/10 ~ 8/10

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
												Honestly? As fun as this game gets to be at the end (at least, somewhat), the main ability that causes fun in the game, namely being able to manipulate the water and stuff in it, comes really close to the end, is quite limited, and it doesn't give you a whole lot of time to adjust to it. That's what really hurts it in my eyes. If they gave you more time with that power, more variations on it than just a pillar of water (possibly even puzzles with a 'parting the seas' kind of thing), and a bit more puzzling than shooting, it'd be amazing. As it stands, slightly meh. The ammo, while giving variety, is mostly useless. You only have to use one of the four extra ammo types at the very end, and I found myself using the default (and infinite, and chargeable) ammo type.Something I would have loved to see is a large area or two where you could get to play with the water manipulation, have it be more central to a puzzle than 'Move box, throw bomb, etc', and just more variation on the power.It's rather short, kinda worth it at bottom sale price, but it's not as stellar as it could have been. It's just a side effect of dated tech, really.In general:Environment: Captures the feel of a dying ship quite well.Story: Leaves A LOT unanswered and feels kinda flat at the end.Gunplay: Works well enough from what I played, variation mostly underused.Movement: Works very well, though a bit tedious to move through water that's just about at swimming depth at times. Swimming is nice and fluid.Ability: Fun, but not enough time to get used to it, nor enough done with it.Graphics: Good enough, but I'm not the type to insta-praise graphics that try to be ultra-realistic for the time.Water Physics: Best. Just.. You can tell that's were a lot of effort went when developing the game.Overall? Par for the time, minus a good bit for the lack of puzzle variety and power utilization, plus a bit for the water physics.5(ish)/10. If you're looking for a decent game for about a dollar (during the current sale), feel free to get it. Just don't get your hopes up too high.Review system: Meh/Bleh. Needs a more.. Precise thing than just Yes/No for reccomending it. But then again, I'm just asking too much from Steam there.

The beginning of the game was kinda rushed i guess, you wake up, grab tablet, go to work, then sh*t goes down, in 2 minutes, you're already in a sinking ship. I just felt that it was rushing you.Now, oh GOSH the lag on this game. I have it lowest settings on an almost brand new laptop and it STILL lags.From what looks like a selling point on the screenshots, you can control water, YES, but um... for the last 10 minutes of the game.... so nvm about that.And as everyone is saying, final boss makes no sence to the story, but my thoughts on the final boss is F*CK THE FINAL BOSS, either my game glitched, or im misunderstanding something, but the enemies that the boss spawns are for some reason invincable for me, and i don't want to have to deal with it.So overall, i'd say the game isn't bad, but it's not good either. It can be fun at times, but sometimes what you're supposed to do isn't exactly clear. It's fun to relieve the Titanic in a futuristic way, but this time with a bad final boss.7.8/10 Too much water

content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												8\10Graphics: 3\5Sound: 2\5Map Design: 4\5Gameplay: 4\5Story: 3\5Just wow. The day i had the fear of sharks in gaming i promised to never touch water again. Until i meet Hydrophobia: Prophecy. A game with fine graphics and a amazingly well designed physical enviroment where water really has a great purpose. 4.99 is not alot to price this and personally it should cost more. The game is short but yet still fun. Even if i did get angry in most sections... Hydrophobia: Prophecy is soo good i even brought my brother a copy in happyness towards this game. There are no sequels i am aware of sadly but I'm sure this game will make its way back.

Posted: May 30, 2014
												If you took Dead Space, minus anything scary, and Mass Effect, minus any semblance of plot, and combined them together you would still have a better game than Hydrophobia: ProphecyThe controls are clunky, the puzzles add up to either "swim up/down" or "jump to ledges and hope the game decides you grabbed them"Any "plot" in this game could be summed up by saying "Die Hard on a Boat in the Future"The voice acting is the sort of dull surprise and awkward shouting that plagued every bargain bin adventure game in the last two decades.I'm trying to find a worse use for five dollars, but even burning them would at least provide some warmth.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
												Honestly? As fun as this game gets to be at the end (at least, somewhat), the main ability that causes fun in the game, namely being able to manipulate the water and stuff in it, comes really close to the end, is quite limited, and it doesn't give you a whole lot of time to adjust to it. That's what really hurts it in my eyes. If they gave you more time with that power, more variations on it than just a pillar of water (possibly even puzzles with a 'parting the seas' kind of thing), and a bit more puzzling than shooting, it'd be amazing. As it stands, slightly meh. The ammo, while giving variety, is mostly useless. You only have to use one of the four extra ammo types at the very end, and I found myself using the default (and infinite, and chargeable) ammo type.Something I would have loved to see is a large area or two where you could get to play with the water manipulation, have it be more central to a puzzle than 'Move box, throw bomb, etc', and just more variation on the power.It's rather short, kinda worth it at bottom sale price, but it's not as stellar as it could have been. It's just a side effect of dated tech, really.In general:Environment: Captures the feel of a dying ship quite well.Story: Leaves A LOT unanswered and feels kinda flat at the end.Gunplay: Works well enough from what I played, variation mostly underused.Movement: Works very well, though a bit tedious to move through water that's just about at swimming depth at times. Swimming is nice and fluid.Ability: Fun, but not enough time to get used to it, nor enough done with it.Graphics: Good enough, but I'm not the type to insta-praise graphics that try to be ultra-realistic for the time.Water Physics: Best. Just.. You can tell that's were a lot of effort went when developing the game.Overall? Par for the time, minus a good bit for the lack of puzzle variety and power utilization, plus a bit for the water physics.5(ish)/10. If you're looking for a decent game for about a dollar (during the current sale), feel free to get it. Just don't get your hopes up too high.Review system: Meh/Bleh. Needs a more.. Precise thing than just Yes/No for reccomending it. But then again, I'm just asking too much from Steam there.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31, 2014
												Lets get right down to it, is Hydrophobia: Prophecy bad?Mechanically its ok, it works, the level design is solid, the water physics are frankly FANTASTIC, and overall the game functions pretty well. This game isn't a buggy mess or unfinished or a slog as I would have expected from the score.Storywise however it could use some work, the dialogue could use some improvement especially in the introduction which has some very shakey voice acting. Combat is somewhat repeditive and an unituitive puzzle required me to shoot some dangling electrical cords right next to some explosive barrels instead of the barrels themselves.Overall though after asking myself "Would this be worth five bucks?" If you can ignore the introduction and don't really mind the plot then I would say this game is definately worth five bucks. Especially the first time you open a door from a flooded room and realize "holy crap this water isn't pre-animated."

content:
Posted: December 12, 2013
												First off...it's a short game.  But it's an interesting game as well that has a bit of challenge too it.  The game has a variety of aspects to it: a bit of puzzle solving, a bit of shooting, a bit of creepy giggling dead girl (stay underwater for a while...you'll start to hear it), and of course...water physics (and of course no game with a female protagonist can avoid the all mighty overamped boob physics).  The water actually reacts in what seems like a realistic way including waves rolling through and walls of water flowing down hallways when doors are opened.  It's a great game if you're waiting for a new game to come out and need something to hold you over for several days.  Definitely worth a look.

content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												I find the environment and  game mechanics from this game worth the 5 dollar price tag. The game is short, but even there, is fun and rewarding. (8 hours for me an still going, some people report 3.5/4 hours,don't get the game rushing thing) If you play with a gamepad everything works as it should, the covering system even working better than some triple A titles. The water environment works ok in 2 aspects -> The interaction with the water (besides diving / swimming you can even "use" it later on the game)-> The "oppression" you feel most of the time, due to the fact that it's a sinking ship Overall, the game justifies the price and it's fun to play. I cannot talk about keyboard / mouse control on this title, since I tend to play all of these game types on game pad from my coach. I guess graphics are ok, but it's not a primary thing on my list. This game gets on bundles often, I say is a plus for the bundle.

Posted: November 15, 2011
												Ok, this game has some AMAZING water effects.  Water flows very much like it would in real life.  It even has a tide that will pull you if you are caught in the current while water is flowing out of your room into the next.Unfortunately, that's really all this title has to offer. Luckily this game was cheap

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2011
												Let's cut too the chase. Hydrophobia is a broken, janky game. Gameplay is finicky, the A.I. is poor, the story is confusing, the acting is inconsistent at best, the deaths are always cheap and its terribly short.And in the end, I don't think I care about any of that.Hydrophobia may be a foundementally flawed game, but it succeeds in delievering an experience you have never encountered in a game. It reminds me a lot of games like Free Radical's 'Second Sight' of EA's 'Mirror's Edge'; both are nowhere near perfect games. But because they offered up a gameplay experience or asethetic distinct from what we as gamers are typically given, makes them capivating and brilliant in their own right. So yes this games is a mess, but for the moments when everything comes together you can't help but find yourself completely taken into the world.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 17, 2011
												I own both the Xbox 360 and PC versions and running them side-by-side, the PC wins hands down. We wouldn't have Hydrophobia if it wasn't for the Xbox Live to give this indie crew a chance, but man... the story depth has really been cleaned up on the PC version and while I really enjoyed what was already there with the X360 version, the addition of the cutscenes is a blessing: it adds so much more to the tension. Graphics have been improved, sound has been improved (though I disagree with replacing the voice actor for Scoot: the original was much better!), controls are open for both gamepad and mouse/keyboard (both with their pros & cons) and the gameplay has benefit a lot from the extra time/funding the development team had for this version. Yes, it's still a work in progress (dev team has added an in-game feedback option for PC gamers), but dammit: you _must_ buy this game. Adventure/action lovers rejoice: Kate knocks the old Lara Croft right out of the park.

												If you took Dead Space, minus anything scary, and Mass Effect, minus any semblance of plot, and combined them together you would still have a better game than Hydrophobia: ProphecyThe controls are clunky, the puzzles add up to either "swim up/down" or "jump to ledges and hope the game decides you grabbed them"Any "plot" in this game could be summed up by saying "Die Hard on a Boat in the Future"The voice acting is the sort of dull surprise and awkward shouting that plagued every bargain bin adventure game in the last two decades.I'm trying to find a worse use for five dollars, but even burning them would at least provide some warmth.

												I bought this on sale, and it was worth what I payed. After completing the first level, with naive optimism that it might get better, the game stopped working. I couldn't load my save file, and when I reached the end of the level, the game crashed. What I did play was... lackluster, for lack of a better term. I took my time, watched the cutscenes, and all I could think is "why am I supposed to care?" Normally, I would give a game an hour or two to give me a reason, but the 15 or so minutes of gameplay didn't do it, and the cutscenes just gave setup for a promising story. But then the fire nation attacked then the terrorists bombed everything. The game was more interesting as a setting (city on a ship, dystopia, etc.) than it was as a game.3/10, made me buy it.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2014
												First Impression Review of Hydrophobia: ProphecyThe first things I noticed when I  turned on this game were that the graphics were beautiful, the voice acting was impressive and my computer would never be able to run it properly in a million years.  After a few restarts and a lot of tweaking of settings I managed to get Hydrophobia to run by sacrificing the graphics and pretty much everything else.When the game starts, it throws you immediately into the story. Hydrophobia: Prophecy is set on a city sized boat called Queen Of The World, sometime during the mid 21st century. Queen Of The World is  having some sort of anniversary celebration (whether anniversary of it’s founding or anniversary of completing a trip around the world I’m not sure) and out of the blue, the main communications server goes offline. Kate Wilson, a systems engineer, goes to investigate. With communications down a terrorist organization called the Malthusians hack the main security computer and a series of explosions rip holes into the hull.Overall, the game seems quite well made with only a few minor bugs (some of the items float randomly when picked up rather than staying in your hand) and a dynamic liquid system that I haven’t seen anywhere else. However, one thing I can criticize is that the level design is quite confusing, often leading me to walk off in the wrong direction with little reward for doing so.As a summary, Hydrophobia: Prophecy is a promising title and from what I’ve seen in my 77 minutes in-game it is well worth its $5.00 price tag, despite its few issues.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												I hate this game.  The gameplay is a boring combination of platforming and shoddy 3rd person shooting in a lame sci-fi ship setting.  I found the main character's voice acting a bit annoying sounding.  Your main weapon is a weird charging beam that one shot's all enemies when you charge it so I don't really know why there's actual ammo when you kill everything in one hit.  The game's main draw is water physics, which is underwhelming.  The water is still scripted to only fill rooms at certain parts and while not annoying, doesn't really add anything to the experience.  The graphics are subpar and the game chugs pathetically at times for no reason.  Only worth $1 or less.  The game is also only 3-4 hours long.

												Great game, but crappy ending.  It's a lot like Tomb Raider but with enough different to not be a clone.  The story is fun and the water and environmental hazards really keep you on your toes.  The end is CRAP! I was so♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥when I saw it.  Not a spoiler in reality since most games have bosses etc.  It's your first and only boss fight and when you win, the game is over. I do recommend it for the overall play, but don't expect any form of an ending that will make you happy.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Graphics: Feels unfinished. too often do i stare at things that only slightly feel out of place. It is however, not bad. Especially when it comes to the water! The water itself would get a solid 10/10, rest of the graphics 6/10, mainly due to the poor cutscene dialogue's (I CANNOT stand impropper lipsyncing).(8/10 Total)Audio:Audio often weirded me out. I understand that the childs voice you hear underwater is PROBABLY from your trauma as you near suffocation underwater.... but hearing them the moment you jump into the water?The voice used for Kate does not feel authentic either.(4/10 total)Story:A horribly generic--- yet enjoyable storyline. The thing is however, that if you'd cut the whole story out, you would not be missing anything essential. The game feels seperated from the story (this may differ if you're a true collecter of collectables and learn more about the backstory). This does not matter however, seeing as the gameplay itself is of great quality.(7/10 total)Overal:The game plays very well, it also has a GREAT feel to it. It does feel a bit unfinished however and i'm sure that with just a bit of polishing it would be perfect feel-wise.Is it worth playing? Yes.Is it worth buying? Maybe. If it's on sale like it is now (-80%, 0,99 cents from 4,99) then yes, definately. The full price of 4,99 however, is barely worth it, seeing as the game is rather short (Completed in under 3 hours)I do however, hope for a sequal to come out in which the audio/graphics are fully polished and the game lasts -+20 hours, which in my opinion, should be easily doable since some of the technique's you unlock at the end (no spoilers) will only be used for puzzling once or never.If they manage to do all that, the game would be worth at least 29,99.Final Score 7/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 17, 2012
												An interesting game with really amazing water physics, but it's unfortunately lacking in some other aspects. But for the low price it went down to, it's a bargain. As I'm writing this, it's just 1,24€ here (on -75% daily deal). The reason to get it is the fantastic water physics implemented that I haven't seen done so well in any other game. You'll enjoy the really natural look of the water filling the sinking ship you're in. It rises, it has currents, waves, very naturally flows out of flooded rooms as you open the door, releasing the water... The surface ripples according to all water movement and reflects the light beautifully. However... this game is very short. And the action aspects (shooting, that is) aren't done so well. The weapons are kinda lame and it generally feels pretty static compared to typical action games. I consider this game a demonstration of the impressive water engine and it's a shame they didn't put as much work on other things. But try it out!

												Bought this while it was on sale for $3.00, let me tell you, THAT WAS A COMPLETE STEAL!  The water physics are amazingly good (better than you will see in any other game for 2011), and even though the plot is small and more or less easy to understand what happened during the events (not so much of the character back story), it's still a good game.  In a small nut shell:Pros:Good (but small) plot.Water physics are amazing.Has an okay cover and fire system.Cons:The camera is a little buggy, but you not to the point that it's unplayable.Depth of Field is going to take a minute or 2 too get used to but again, not a major issue.Expect to die a few times because you are up against AI with Shotguns and ARs while you only have a pistol (with different ammo types but you will mostly be using stun like ammo.) and your health is a joke.I know there are more cons then Pros, but its really a good game.

												A really fun game with the best water physics and any game. EVER. The gameplay is fun and the water adds a whole new dynamic to the gameplay.If an enemy is shooting at you you can do various things such as using a sonic round to send a wave at him or shooting some of the environmental items like damaged walls to flood the room or electrical panels to electrocute the enemy.I highly recommend it, at the moment it has a few performance issues but those are being ironed out by the patches.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 24, 2012
												Best 1.99 I ever spent.  Decent 3rd-person shooter/platformer that gets by with its unique setting and stunning water effects.  Even years after Hydrophobia's release, its water effects remain unsurpassed.  It flows, splashes, and roars around you while fire and sparks reflect beautifully and convincingly on its surface.  Top notch lighting design and effects also set the mood.   You play an engineer stuck on a giant, sinking, futuristic cruise ship fighting off doomsday terrorists.  The story gives the designers an excuse to stage claustrophic, tense, water logged scenarios reminiscent of the Sega classic Burning Rangers or the film Deep Rising.  It's an uncommon setting in games (perhaps because water was difficult to pull off) and it helps make Hydrophobia stand out from the pack.   The game's low budget origins are apparent-- the characters models are weak and the ending is very abrupt -- but so is its ambition.  Recommended.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 11, 2011
												This game had quite a bit of potential going for it, all of which falls flat on its face by the end. The controls are clunky fit awkwardly with the sudden changes in camera behavior, especially when entering water. Enemies will appear seemingly at random around you, including behind you and from locations you were just in. Graphical glitches crop up frequently, including ones where the floor and wall textures fail to load. The design flaws are numerous, including one noteable example of being knocked to my death in a forced animation by a scripted sequence where terrain collapses as the character is climbing up some debris.The level design is poor, not utilizing any external environments at all which could have aided in both the game's quality and length  as it's set on a giant boat yet at no point do you go outside and are instead relgated to wandering a series of corridors within the ship's bowels. Also, this game is very short, only a few hours of play at best.Buy only under $5.

content:
Posted: October 25, 2011
												Game is good, kind of easy.  Graphics are good, but bland, though the water's graphics are done pretty good. The games sound was kinda annoying clicks and pops freaquent when changing areas, or other times as well.The Story was good, but the ending left a lot to be desired, and left a lot of things unanswered, (take in mind I was drinking a good bit of  wine when I beat the final boss.) The ending {while it made sense} left a lot of things unanswered and a lot of loose ends.So you are asking why is It I am recommending it?  The gameplay is the main reason. It was just really fun, it was a fantastic adventure. I would love to play a more fleshed out Sequel (just opitmize it more, way too much gpu power for what is offered on screen in this game, need to work on that). The way that it played and the ideas presented and the way you progress was just really fun to play. I enjoyed it greatly.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 2, 2011
												Interesting take on the 'Survival' genre.  Decent value.Plot seems nice while story is a little weak.  You're a super-smart-super-brave systems engineer that just happens to be a totally-in-shape rock climber in her spare time and also, judging by the award on her kitchen table in the beginning (from 7th grade?!), an accomplished swimmer and combat shows her to be a crack shot with a pistol as well.Wish they played up the 'Hydrophobia' aspect of the game as well as it seems the main character suffers from it, and it is the namesake of the game.  She does verbally freak out when an area floods, but other than that stays calm as water rapidly floods and while she swims past dead bodies and such.The whole reason I got this game tho was the amazing water physics, and to me, they more than make up for the shortcomings of the game.  The way the water flows, pushes against your character, floods through doorways as they open, etc are all fantastic and add an extra dimension to gameplay.

content:
Posted: September 4, 2012
												For less than $5, it's probably worth checking out. But don't expect it to be a solid shooter, because it's anything but. Pretty much every mechanic is this game feels clunky in one way or another, and even the water physics feel rather strange despite it being the main feature. Underwater combat can get pretty hectic as enemies can come from any direction, barrels and crap floating around more often than not, get in the way of combat. And oh, did I mention that the enemy uses bullet while you use a sonic gun which projectiles are larger and move slower? Also have a slower firing rate? You do get some sort of superpower towards the end, but it's not so super, and well... Rather disappointing.That said, the water mechanics are interesting to look at and is rather unique. Grab it during a sale if you can though.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												The water effects and quantity in this game are great, but pretty much nothing else even approaches average.Apparently, this was supposed to be episode 1 in a trilogy, but the rest will never get made, so the player character ends the story on a cliffhanger and the other main good guy character simply disappears late in the game and never reappears. The game literally ends with what feels like an incomplete cutscene.Voice acting is bad. Reminded me of the "Reboot" series from the 90s or something similar. Everyone kind of seemed like small-town community theatre actors.One of my "cardinal sins" of bad game design is introducing completely new game mechanics in the final 5-10% of the game, and this game does that.Gameplay is repetitive and sometimes unclear, and the only "challenges" come from frustrating design decisions like very unclear routes you have to take while your oxygen supply requires you to go directly to the exit with no detours, as well a couple areas with respawning enemies that you can't see under the water.Combat is average or below. There are thousands of explodable objects that you can use to kill enemies, which means very little challenge, really.The final boss fight is pretty stupid and easy.All in all, the game will take you about 2.5-3 hours to beat, although it really does feel tedious even at that length.Anyways, if you've got $0.50 and really really really want to see some nice water effects, you might want to buy it, but there are probably over 500 better games that cost less than $5 on Steam if you're willing to wait for sales, and life is pretty short...

content:
Posted: September 2, 2011
												Where do I start? First of all, I'm guilty of playing this game on a computer that barely meets the minimum requirements. I have to say, the graphics are phenomenal, the rendering is near perfect and the enviromental effects (water, fire, smoke) are absolutely stunning. It's truly a beautiful game, but after you get past oogling at it's undercarriage you realize a few things:  The controls are as spastic as a schizophrenic hummingbird, the storyline is painfully generic and the gameplay is complete crap. This is the "fixed" edition of the game that the devs gave a once over because of previous complaints and It still sucks. When you're a 110 pound girl in a cruise ship filling fast with water and shaking like a crack-♥♥♥♥♥ in rehab, fine tuned controls mean everything, and when you can't even get that right, you've got a game that's doomed from the start. This game is like buying a '67 Shelby Cobra in mint condition without a steering wheel and the break lines are cut. Disappointed...

												This game plays a lot like if Tomb Raider were made by an indie developer, except replace Lara Croft with the whiniest protagonist since my gigapet who I refused to feed in 4th grade. I'm not far along in the game, but it's got some epic moments only minutes into gameplay. Outrunning the waves of water that plow into the rooms and explode out the walls is extremely impressive and very cool.The story is very great as well for as much as I've played. Basically you're on a ship (I think?) that's being taken over by a terrorist group/cult and sunk into the ocean. You play as Kate, who I'm assuming was like a Cruise assistant lady or something...I don't know, and I don't care. This game has done me a huge favor in sparing me the dumb details and giving me a simple, kill the terrorist, escape the ship, and don't drown experience. Also everytime she says "Jesus," in a bad situation, it sounds like she is literally addressing the Son of God. You'll hear it everytime now too. Enjoy!

content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
												Hydrophobia...  [Fear of Water]Where do I even begin with this game?It's like a Tomb Raider-esque Action game and it involes a LOT of swimming as the main part of the gameplay.You climb up ledges, pipes, jumping backwards to grab other ledges so on and so forth. [And at the last part of the game you got powers to control water.]The game is so damn short: It's a no wonder it is classed as an arcade game by XBL.The dynamic water is one of the good things about the game, the cover is pretty solid as well as turning around the corner as well as five kinds of unique ammunition to playthrough. There is the tablet where you have the waypoint and you figure out the passwords by scanning it to proceed further, there's the wavelength puzzles which is one of the easiest parts of the game to do but it works solid.The swimming mechanics can really be tedious. What kind of game where you cannot resurface to the water when you have your gun out?! Also the Water Power controls are quite a nuisance to control as well.The game is 5/10 for me. It's not good but not bad either.. It's kind of an average, short game. I wouldn't reccommend this game for anything else: just. It's one of the games that looks pretty unique but the story is generic and the ending is somewhat anti-climactic.. :/

												I feel bad for this game and its developers.  I wanted to be able to like it, for their vision, but in the end they remind me of the hill-billy domestic terrorists in Oregon. A shame, because it had some kernels of genuine potential, a fascinating setting, genuinely interesting water physics, and the hydro-kinesis that only made an appearance at the very tale end.  Unfortunately these were drowned out entirely by the oceans of inadequacies in the rest of the game.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
It's not very good. 4/10.It's Unfinished: It feels like a demo you have to pay for. The game time I have is the entire game, minus the challenge room (about ~30 extra minutes).Terrible Voiceacting: Grating, low-quality, and the script was probably written by a 16 year old with a Tumblr blog.Impressive Physics: It feels like the entire budget went into the water physics, since it's the best thing about this game! It's a very unique trait in a video game.Awful Campaign: The story explains literally nothing, and ends as if you beat a demo for a full game. If anything, this was just to test the physics engine they used for the water.No Content: It's just a collectathon with only a handful of mediocre achievements and nothing to explore. It's a very minimal and boring game.Additional Notes and CommentaryI can't repeat it enough, but this literally is just a demo to me. The campaign is incredibly short, and ends abruptly like you just finished the first chapter of a really long campaign; except you kill the only main antagonist in the story.The only reason it got any score is because the physics engine used for the water was impressive and fun to mess around with. You could flood hallways and entire rooms by shooting weak walls or shattering windows, or even just opening doors! Then you could shoot explosive barrels to make all sorts of crazy physics happen. This was literally the only good thing in the game to me.Would I recommend this game at all? Absolutely not. I bought it for about $2 and think it shouldn't be worth anything at all. The story was terrible, the voiceacting was probably the worst thing about the game, and it made me skip every cutscene in the game, because it was nothing but a guy over a comm making sex jokes at the female protagonist.

												This is something like Dead Space (you 're an engineer and wander all over a ship fetching things and offing bad guys) and something like Mirror's Edge (female PC, lots of climbing, red pipes). 												Even at $3 this game is overpriced. It looks, feels and sounds like some interns made it and voice acted it. The gameplay is like a poor man's Assassins Creed, only with terrible controls and plot, with a linear path. 												This is not exactly a recomendation... I enjoyed this game at the price I got it (like $3) But I don't understand what happened at the end.I loved the water physics, it was really imersive when a riptide of water cames in through a bulkhead and knocks everyone off their feet. Underwater combat is a joke, everyone can breathe underwater but you, guns are ineffective unless you're the main character using the infinite charge gun, and everyone always knows where you are.Unfortunately, by the time you get the promised water manipulation powers the game is already over. Seriously! You get the water powers about fifteen minutes before the end of the game. The final boss is a joke, a big robot that you attack twice. TWICE! And then the big baddie gets electorcuted and you get rid of your super powers with the antidote. Lame.My guess is that they ran out of funds, and had to cobble together the finally just as things were getting interesting.So much potential!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
												The biggest thing I can say about Hydrophobia is that it's damn short. At under three hours, it's one of the shortest commercial releases I know of. It's a third-person shooter with a bit of Uncharted-style climbing, a hacking minigame, and a surprise gameplay twist near the end I won't spoil here, simply because it comes literally out of nowhere. I bought the game about three years ago and never touched it before today, but it proved a satisfying diversion. Hydrophobia is most notable for its water physics- player character Kate Wilson, a systems engineer, is aboard a massive oceangoing vessel in the midst of a terrorist attack, and nearly every area is at least partially flooded. This can be used to the player's advantage, triggering bulkhead breaches to toss enemies about in addition to the more genre-standard exploding barrels and exposed electrical currents. The swimming controls are competent and you have a generous oxygen meter, although the camera can be disorienting. Uniquely, you can grab objects such as crates while underwater and use them as portable cover. You have only one gun, a pistol, but it can be used with five different ammuntion types, including remote-trigger grenades. Hydrophobia succeeds better as an entire game about water levels then most games do in a single segment, and on that merit alone I can recommend it. It seems this title was  the first episode of a series, but the developer has since closed without further episodes being made and this title ends on an extremely abrupt cliffhanger. If that doesn't bother you however, Hydrophobia will make for an enjoyable afternoon.

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 26, 2015
												This game is pretty poorly made and I had to run it on lowest with 800x600 resolution to get no lag, anything above that made it lag like crazy and my PC passes the requirements by far.I don´t know why, but I need to write kind of a full review on this even if nowhere near professional. I´ll try to keep spoilers out as much as possible for anyone that could care about the story.This game is super short, myself I beat it around 4 hours.Story: Some terrorists invade your home/ship/whatever (???), you try to escape and get powers because reasons. The game didn´t tell much that I understood, there´s 0 connection to the characters and why they are doing what they are doing. For example: why in the world would the main characters friend stay to risk his own life just to make really dumb jokes and being almost useless? Said friend is just gone later in the game and is never heard from ever again.Final boss is not explained why it´s there, the ending is just dumb and everything is just horribly cheesy.Gameplay: It´s a third person shooter with climbing. swimming and platforming. Sounds great, right? It´s not. The shooting is alright at best, but the platforming... oh god the platforming is bad. I found myself going climbing down instead of up, and sometimes just falling to my death because why not. The best part is the swimming. If there's anything good in this game, it´s the water. It would be the perfect swimming simulator if there wasn´t this little girls voice constantly giggling and screaming inaudible stuff. I get what it´s trying to do with the whole fear of drowning thing, but a little girls giggling only makes it annoying.Now the shooting. The shooting is pretty good, only one big flaw: the ai. The ai really loves to walk into you and shoot you until you are dead, but at least you get to kill stuff... in water.Graphics: The graphics look really nice even on lowest settings. Most people would tear their eyes out because they want super realistic graphics, but I say the graphics is alright in my book.The water isn´t ultra realistic, but it looks good enough. Probably don´t belong here, but I really liked that the water kept slowly rising instead of just stopping at a certain point... mmm, water.Audio: Wow. The voice acting is actually better than a certain bad game about motorcycles and revenge... at least they attempt to bring life to the voices instead of simply reading off a script... mostly. Water sounds? Sounds realistic enough. And that´s all that matters in this game. Water.Summary: If you enjoy swimming, drowning and shooting in third person then this is for you. I actually would recommend this game, despite the flaws I had some fun out of it and the cringy dialogue made me keep going to hear more bad lines. Worth the full price? Hell no. Wait for a price drop or a sale, then buy it.Also water.

												So my initial impressions of this game were that is was a fairly low budget production with some interesting ideas and good use of in game physics, particularly with regards to the water. Well worth a purchase in a sale for a 3-4 hour experience. However, that's when I got to Act 2 and the crashes began. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												I didn't enjoy this game as much as I hoped I would. The whole water gimmick was cool at first, but eventually just became annoying.Graphics: The water graphics, for the most part, look decent. The graphics design is pretty cool, although I'm a sucker for the whole cyberpunk futuristic look. Other than that it's nothing too special.Story: The voice acting is pretty bad, which makes it hard to care about the characters. The story itself is relatively straightforward and cliched, and is a whopping 3 hours long, so that is definitely not a selling point of this game. The writing is uninspired, although there was one line that made me laugh: "I've got two balls and neither one is crystal."Gameplay: The gimmick of this game is the use of large amounts of water to your advantage, whether it be to access high areas, put out fires, or sweep enemies off of their feet. That feature itself was pretty well done, but it was not utilized very often, and when it was, it was laid out step by step. There was absolutely no intuition required, which made the mechanic pretty boring. Other than that, the cover system is frustratingly bad, the gunplay is unsatisfying, and the controls are stiff.Overall, don't spend your time or money with this game, unless you're a...uh...water fanatic? It's really nothing special and I found myself frustrated more often than entertained. 3/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 10, 2015
												This is the worst game that I have ever played through to completion. The only reason that was possible is because even on the hardest difficulty it was over in about 4-5 hours. The gunplay is terrible(enjoy shooting walls while your enemies shoot through them), the story is abysmal, and the dialog and voiceovers make you want to kill the lead character. There is a single weapon with 5 different types of ammo, and a single power to move around a pile of water that you only get just before the last boss in the game. The game gives you extra points for blowing up every shootable part of the ship WHICH YOU ARE AN ENGINEER ON and theoretically are trying to save or something. The ONLY good thing about this is the water, which is pretty, and has very good physics. Otherwise, prepare yourself for a truely subpar, uninspired, clunky game that tries to rip off the Bioshock series, but doesn't even manage to steal their ideas well.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
												I bought this game to test my new debit card for 0,49 euros back before refunds existed...I regret spending that money.This...is a very, very bad game. I wanted to beat the game for the sake of being able to give a review based on the complete game, but I just couldn't make myself finish it. In the hour and a half spent on the game, I finished around half the game judging by the collectibles and chapter select. It just isn't worth any more time.I am desperately trying to find something positive in this game. If I had to pick, I would say that for the time when this game came out, the water physics are pretty good. Other than that...First of all, apart from water, everything else looks bland and generic. Not only are the graphics bad, with human animations being some of the worst I've seen, but apart from fire and water, everything else is either grey, blue, yellow or red. During the time I spent with it, I never left generic sci-fi corridors which all look the same.There is a story, but the dialog and voice acting are so awful that I couldn't make myself listen to them. And even if I did, it is impossible to piece together what is going on. Somebody is attacking the station our protagonist lives on, for reasons I never understood, nor could get myself to care about. The characters are so bad and generic, there is some hint that the protagonist is special in some way but I didn't reach that point in the game, and I think that even if I did I wouldn't care.The pacing and gameplay are also very bad. In the time I played, I only had two enemy encounters, the rest was platforming and swimming. Not very challenging, and very boring with little to no challenge. There were a few puzzles, but those seem more like padding than actual gameplay mechanics. And the controls are terrible, often causing me to jump in a completely different direction from the one I wanted.All in all, don't buy this game, it isn't worth your time, nor your money.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 28, 2013
												Despite the reviews that have averaged around 64/100, the game itself must be looked at not for its longevity or story.. It needs to be looked at for it's signature greatness: Realistic water physics! Seriously, for a indie title like this that was created by a handful of developers, it is very very hard to imagine why the hell many AAA title game developers with a extremely high budget can't pump out the same, if not better of a water-physics game! So simply put, if you don't understand what makes this so unique, here it is:The water is very dynamic, and uses Cosine trig functions as a basis for the water's modelling. The water uses many properties from real physics: Room 1 has lower water level, Room 2 has higher water level.. Door opens between the rooms, and Room 2's water flows into Room 1's water until it evens out.Even more exciting: When water flows into a room, waves will come through, pushing your player away, and the water smacks up against a wall them moves in the opposite direction. The water in this game can be manipulated too. If you shoot a glass window with a room full of water, the window will burst and in comes the massive amounts of water. The game is just pure awesome JUST because of the great water physics modelling. Everything else about this game is mediocre, and I can't justify paying full price ($15.00) for this game. I got it on sale and could justify the sale of ($7.00) or lower.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 16, 2014
												This is actually a pretty damn enjoyable game (especially at the DAFT-CHEAP price of 40pence(!) when on sale)The Movement / Cover and Weapon usage is passable to Good...Sadly, the story / acting both pretty poor.butMany of the other mechanics here are Decent and FULL of Potential (this was originally planned as a D/L trilogy but only part 1 was ever released)The climbing/Bal;ancing/swimming etc all work nicely together, but the Best Bits of all - and something that happens in No other game- is the water mechanic where the water has real weight and heft. You are on a gigantic sinking ship and, say, you're in a corridor, and a sealed room next to you is full of sea-water, you can shoot out the window and it'll come pounding into the corridor washing everything (and you / Bad Guys) away Very Realistically.You can Electrify the Water/Put out Fires, and so on, Escape as Ocean slowly fills a whole ships levels up with swirling,pushing Ocean, with you desperately trying to get out before it gets to the ceiling and you have no breath left etc. All this Dynamic is unique in gaming and solidly Exciting to enact.(the main character, 'Kate' I think, had a childhood accident in a small Dinghy that killed a Family member, so now she is terrified of Water/Drowning: (Hence the "HydroPhobia" of the title) and she begins to freak out when water gets over her head). The potential for this Tech is just boggling...(if they were ever return to Rapture say, for the final time - With the whole place coming apart,piece by piece, Then this Water Tech would be Incredible to use.Also it was only like a 7 Person team who made this, so not entirely fair to judge by AAA standards - Personally, I think it stands up fairly well, and could have gone on to do Great things ( as you get some kinda 'Water-Controlling' Tech, later in the Game - And use it to overcome the Bads /Solve puzzles Etc which is utterly unique idea ) . Damn Shame.Microsoft bought the Engine in 2010ish but haven't done a thing with it since then - Even a new "Silent Hunter" Sub-Sim, with huge rolling waves at Sea would be Super-Good, I hope they DO do Something with it (or Give it to the MODders to use)WELL WORTH THE PRICE - I personally enjoyed the Game; and was awestruck by the potential of the Tech seen here  7.5/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 21, 2014
												This game is short and sweet, but not bad if you can get it on sale for under $2. Playing through the single player mission should take between 3 and 5 hours, so it won't provide endless hours of entertainment or anything.The story is simple and mostly straightforward. There is very little wordlbuilding, and it just kind of throws you into the action. The two heroes are simple characters, and the one you control, Kate, is constantly whining, but has some good moves.The game features various kinds of ammo, but I really only ended up using the infinite sonic rounds that it gives you. I liked the fact that there were objects that could be blown up to kill enemies, which left some room for creativity. There is a mechanic for hiding behind walls, which is pretty useful and effective. The mechanic for hacking is pretty standard, just matching sine waves together.The real star of the show was the water, as it was beautiful and the physics were amazing. Unwater challenges were difficult, as the physics changed when you fought underwater, and certain areas were hard to get past without running out of breath. The water and fire and chaos made it hard to see what was happening, and I was caught off guard by enemies sometimes, which perhaps made it more of a challenge.Overall  I would recommend this game if you can get it on sale. I bought it for 49 cents, but would have gladly paid a little more. The gameplay needs some work and the story is nothing special, but the graphics look great.

content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												So, this game is very short, and the combat is sub-par, but it is still a good game to grab for the price.It is a very cool game, the water physics is very fun to mess around in, and it is very good. The combat could use some improvement, but overall it is alright. The main problem is the climbing. If you do not run Vsync, you are going to have a very bad time. If you don't believe me, try to compare. You have to run it with it, it makes the combat so smoother, and you cannot complete the game without it, so make sure to enable it. The other lacking part is the story. Bland, boring, and most of all, it doesn't have an ending. It has no closure, and it kinda just rolls to the credits, which is a shame, because it seems like a cool world. You are on a giant ship, and it starts to flood from a terrorist attack. That is pretty much all they say. You don't know why, you don't know the characters, you only really learn your name from the character talking to herself (Which I still don't know what it is.) But still, if you like Tomb Raider, you will probably enjoy this game.6.75/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												Overall: 7/10Graphics: 8/10Gameplay: 7/10Story: 6/10I know this game gets a bad rap for being short and having a lacking story, but I found it easy to get into the story and keep up.  It's something you have to pay attention to.  I didn't find the story really all that boring, I'm just disappointed that you don't get your powers until late in the game when they're a bit irrelevant.  (I'm so used to shooting my guns that I don't know if I'll use the powers much.)  I also liked that the main focus, water, had life to it.  It wasn't just something that was everywhere and utterly useless, you could actually use it to progress in the game.  Need to go up one level but no stairs/ladder/etc?  Can't go through a door because there is a fire right in front of it?   Shoot a wall and ride the flood.   Need to get to the next part of the story and don't feel like killing your way through a group of 10 guys?  You guessed it, OPEN THE FLOOD GATES AND SHOOT DOWN SOME POWER LINES.  Too many indie developers go for generic, popular themes such as the ever popular Zombie shooter or some post-apocalyptic world that has little to no back story as to how things happened (or it takes forever to know the full story).  It's refreshing that they did their own spin on a futuristic dying Earth where the problem was over-population and not some catastrophic apocolyptic event.  For $5($0.49 during steam sales), this game gives you your money's worth and 8 times out of 10 you'll enjoy playing this for a few hours.  I got this through a Humble Bundle, so I didn't pay more than $0.10 for it, therefore take what I say with a grain of salt.

												this game doesnt know what its trying to beFirst its really poorly controlled platforming, then it throws puzzles like tomb raider except not as good or well thought out, then its thrust you in by the second act into a poorly done third person shooterThe story is laughably bad, The game is set in the mid 21st century when the world has fallen into the chaos of the "Great Population Flood", and takes place aboard the Queen of the World, a city-sized luxury ocean vessel, built by a group known as the Five Founding Fathers At the beginning of the game, the craft is bombed by a group of fanatical terrorists known as the Malthusians—named after political economist Thomas Malthus who predicted that population growth would one day outpace agricultural production, returning society to a subsistent level of existence.[6] The Malthusians have a plan to murder the vast majority of humans on the planet, so that the survivors wouldn't suffer from the effects of the population explosion.  written on the walls such as "kill yourself" which you find all over the ship you play Kate Wilson who is an engineer on the ship & whines about everything while getting her friend nick to help her get off the slowly sinking shipThe writing for this story is beyond terrible, its cringe worthyfor example Kate gets mad at nick for not warning her about 2 enemies in the next room, his response "kate i have 2 balls & none are crystal"  This line right here made me want to drop the controller Hydrophobia feels like a nice little tech demo to display this new Hydro engine, which the water is beautiful buttttt why should i care when your game built for the engine is so cocking awfulAvoid at all cost

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
												So I just finished playing Hydrophobia. Here's some thoughts.Flow and mood are excellent. The scenes were well-directed.Puzzle-solving was... it would have been good but there was a lot of hand-holding; you basically follow a carrot on a stick through the whole game, which feels largely on rails.They sold the game based on the idea that you'd have cool hydrokinesis powers, but you only have them for the last 15% of the game if that.The hydrokinesis is cludgy to control and not all that useful. You can't use it from cover and it's less powerful as a weapon than the sonic stun bullets you use for the other 85% of the game.You also get real bullets but they suck so I never really used them. The sonic rounds have more stopping power and accuracy so why would I use semiauto or fullauto?There's some stealth for about 5 minutes but you end up shooting everyone in the face anyway.After the game ends you unlock a "challenge room" but I don't care.---SPOILERS BELOW---There is one boss fight, a robot gun thing. When you kill it, the antagonist gets electrocuted, you cure your water-power poisoning, and then it fades to black, roll credits.You never get the deeper explanation of the conflict, just "crazy cult wants to cull humans". you never meet up with your pal who helped you through the first 75% of the game over the radio.I'm glad I played it. I'm also glad I got it on sale.I want more in the world of the game but I know it won't happen.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												I didn't enjoy this game as much as I hoped I would. The whole water gimmick was cool at first, but eventually just became annoying.Graphics: The water graphics, for the most part, look decent. The graphics design is pretty cool, although I'm a sucker for the whole cyberpunk futuristic look. Other than that it's nothing too special.Story: The voice acting is pretty bad, which makes it hard to care about the characters. The story itself is relatively straightforward and cliched, and is a whopping 3 hours long, so that is definitely not a selling point of this game. The writing is uninspired, although there was one line that made me laugh: "I've got two balls and neither one is crystal."Gameplay: The gimmick of this game is the use of large amounts of water to your advantage, whether it be to access high areas, put out fires, or sweep enemies off of their feet. That feature itself was pretty well done, but it was not utilized very often, and when it was, it was laid out step by step. There was absolutely no intuition required, which made the mechanic pretty boring. Other than that, the cover system is frustratingly bad, the gunplay is unsatisfying, and the controls are stiff.Overall, don't spend your time or money with this game, unless you're a...uh...water fanatic? It's really nothing special and I found myself frustrated more often than entertained. 3/10

												Its a shame this one didn't get better reviews.  We look at the fluidic graphics now and say, "meh", but in its day it was something new and beautiful to behold.  The story here is lacking only in that you never really get to find out WHY the water is rising from start to finish.  It feels like you on a sinking ship, but its never let on that anything close to that is going on.  Setting that aside, the story and character development is logical and intriguing, the graphics are at least passing for any pro game and at best stunning visually.  The attacks and expandible character abilities are original and well thought out.  Definitely one of the best and most detailed indy 3rd person adventures I've ever played.

Its a lot of fun just to play with the water in the ship's corridors.Taking it for what it is, I had more fun in Hydrophobia's campy, sometimes muddled world than I have had in most AAA titles.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												I don't normally post reviews, but the experience of this game really left me wanting to say something about  it.First of all, I strictly recommend this game based on the environments and narrative, and as something to experience and analyse. I wouldn't say it's a good game at all, given how every interactive portion has its bugbears and in some of the standards of games (glitchiness, depth and/or satisfaction of interactivity, voiceacting and character performance) it's lacking. However, if it were a graphic novel or something of that nature it would be very solid, as far as games go.The game is divided into three acts, roughly associated with gameplay aspects of the game. Act One is almost entirely "platforming," hacking, and learning about the lore of the game. I found the flavour, especially subtle parts interwoven with the gameplay like the horror-esque sounds you hear when near and submerged in water, to be intriguing. Act Two is when you get a gun and start engaging in combat. I never, aside from the end where other rounds are required, used anything but sonic rounds for the gun so maybe I didn't get the full perspective on the combat. What combat I did partake in was fairly entertaining, concussing enemies and utilizing environmental hazards, but dragged on for too long to remain interesting. Near the end of Act Three you get the fabled water powers. After becoming inured to the gun combat, I enjoyed using the water powers to throw objects and disorient enemies. Once I adjusted to the essentially one-note power it seemed as though the buildup throughout the rest of the game hadn't had enough payoff. I felt like the designers didn't allow enough time to figure out exactly how the water powers, simple as they are, affected enemies and the dynamic environment and it would have been nice to gain a power more complex than "use water to lift and move/throw things/people". Even being able to throw the water itself at enemies for a more reliable stun or kill would have been good enough for me.In short, the game feels like a long demo. At no point in the game do hints on what to do and how to do it stop appearing (by default, anyway), and each of the sections acquainting players with the interactive elements could have been made much shorter to allow more/better-implemented narrative elements, variations in gameplay, or just a more solid version of what it currently is. Like a good demo, what this game leaves me feeling is unfulfilled and wanting more. Maybe that's what the developers intended, and kudos to them for making something that's at least intriguing, but I will be very disappointed if this game is a one-off that they don't build upon or follow up with in any way.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 28, 2013
												Despite the reviews that have averaged around 64/100, the game itself must be looked at not for its longevity or story.. It needs to be looked at for it's signature greatness: Realistic water physics! Seriously, for a indie title like this that was created by a handful of developers, it is very very hard to imagine why the hell many AAA title game developers with a extremely high budget can't pump out the same, if not better of a water-physics game! So simply put, if you don't understand what makes this so unique, here it is:The water is very dynamic, and uses Cosine trig functions as a basis for the water's modelling. The water uses many properties from real physics: Room 1 has lower water level, Room 2 has higher water level.. Door opens between the rooms, and Room 2's water flows into Room 1's water until it evens out.Even more exciting: When water flows into a room, waves will come through, pushing your player away, and the water smacks up against a wall them moves in the opposite direction. The water in this game can be manipulated too. If you shoot a glass window with a room full of water, the window will burst and in comes the massive amounts of water. The game is just pure awesome JUST because of the great water physics modelling. Everything else about this game is mediocre, and I can't justify paying full price ($15.00) for this game. I got it on sale and could justify the sale of ($7.00) or lower.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 21, 2014
												This game is short and sweet, but not bad if you can get it on sale for under $2. Playing through the single player mission should take between 3 and 5 hours, so it won't provide endless hours of entertainment or anything.The story is simple and mostly straightforward. There is very little wordlbuilding, and it just kind of throws you into the action. The two heroes are simple characters, and the one you control, Kate, is constantly whining, but has some good moves.The game features various kinds of ammo, but I really only ended up using the infinite sonic rounds that it gives you. I liked the fact that there were objects that could be blown up to kill enemies, which left some room for creativity. There is a mechanic for hiding behind walls, which is pretty useful and effective. The mechanic for hacking is pretty standard, just matching sine waves together.The real star of the show was the water, as it was beautiful and the physics were amazing. Unwater challenges were difficult, as the physics changed when you fought underwater, and certain areas were hard to get past without running out of breath. The water and fire and chaos made it hard to see what was happening, and I was caught off guard by enemies sometimes, which perhaps made it more of a challenge.Overall  I would recommend this game if you can get it on sale. I bought it for 49 cents, but would have gladly paid a little more. The gameplay needs some work and the story is nothing special, but the graphics look great.

content:
Posted: September 19, 2014
												At USD$0.37, you can't go wrong with Hydrophobia. It's your standard 3rd person shooter on a sinking ocean liner. If you are in the mood for janky shooting mechanics, controls, ai and animations then you're in the right place. The graphics and water physics on the other hand are quite impressive. I'd give it an A+ for ambition and C- for execution. Just like their previous games(Rise of the Robots & Theatre of Pain) it's all style over substance.Recommended if you can get it below USD$0.50

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												First and formost, it is a relativly short game. It took me 3 hours to get through the story, I did it in one sitting. But it was very much worth the money I paid for it on sale. I feel I ripped them off buying it on sale.Moving on, I found it to be a fantastic game that left me wanting significantly more game from it. The only real criticism I have for it, was the shooting paired with the AI. I played it on the normal difficulty, but the AI seemed to really always know where I was, and were able to kill me signifantly easier than I would have expected. Shooting was a bit bulky and left me wanting, but it was plenty functional.Overall, I will say, buy this game, and just take the timeout of your day to play through it. It was very entertaining.

content:
Posted: October 22, 2012
												Overall? Poor. Puzzles? Abysmal. Combat? Terrible. Water Combat? Even Worse. Story? Okay. Movement? Incredibly non-fluent. Voice acting? OH MY GOD PLEASE STOP. Water Physics? Fan-♥♥♥♥ing tastic. Hydrophobia Prophecy is an extremely poor game surrounding an amazing engine. I wish the water was put out by fire. I wish I could play with the water. I wish there was more combat involving environmental factors. I wish the AI wasn't completely stupid. I wish the water was involved in puzzles instead of poor gimicky combat. Basically, I wish Hydrophobia Prophecy was a good game. Look at the logo. It shows you using the lovely magic water power. You don't get that in a long long time. By then, the game frustrated me beyond redemption, and even then playing with the water was disappointing. I do not recommend it. And that's sad, because I can't tell if watching the great water physics was worth the 4.79 I paid.

content:
Posted: August 21, 2016
												TLDR: Get when 5 dollars or less. It's a good physics demo but not a good game.The water physics are worth experiencing.The game is very interesting for a showoff of a well developed water physics engine. That's really the whole point of the game and it is the protagonist and antagonist. You play as a security detail that suddenly gets flooded in during an uprising of the facility with the invisible guidance of your totally-not-boyfriend in a puzzle/shooter while racing or working against water for the most part.The shooting elements aren't very interesting. You have a few ammo types and an infinite ammo type but these fights are nothing to write home about. It's just a third person shooter.The story wasn't all that moving. Rebels are uprising against the water-bound facility and you're trying to overcome your personal fear of water to stop the bad guy who somehow ties into this.Now the selling point of the game is intended to be playing with water. You shoot out glass barriers and open doors to flood in a large current which turns the whole place upside down. Unfortunately the whole water-bender magic only happens in the last chapter of the game which is a really short time. You don't get to play with the magic as much as you should.For a tech demo, I'd say it's worth it when five bucks or even on sale for less than that.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 30
												I know this game is meant to demonstrate the HydroEngine, not to tell a story.   I do, however, feel good about playing this game as it was a clear and easy to understand 5 hour example of how NOT to tell a story.  The boss fight aside(which isn't as difficult as people say it is.  Stay on one side, expose yourself and run around until she shoots the missles that expose her sensitive side, hide behind pillar to avoid missles, even if you fall down you likely won't die.  energy her private parts, blow her face up with barrel.  Take care of bad guys with explosive rounds.  PRO TIP, they will hide behind boxes, shoot the rounds at the boxes not the guys, when you hit L-shoulder, the guys will die.  If you stay on one side you only need worry about the adds that spawn in front and back.  The adds on the other side will likely die as they traverse towards you.  As soon as she comes out, repeat as quick as possible.  the quicker you deal with her, the less you need to worry about adds.  she dies on the 3rd barrel to the face, meaning if you are quick enough, you don't even need to finish all the adds on the second round) what I learned from this game is that its ok to tell the player to turn off as many gas valves and electrical panels as you want, as long as the reason to do so is something the player cares about.  Stopping terroists as a compelling reason ended after Y2K (Yep, I bet half the people reading this are googling "Y2K" right now).  Good VS Evil trope is BORING because no one sees such a dileneated reality anymore.  If you want me to think stopping bad people is important, you need to let me decide if they are bad.  Apparently Spec Ops: the line tells a good story so I will be seeing whats over there for now.  I can't neg this game due to bad story because I would then be negging most games I play.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 27, 2012
												Hydrophobia quickly goes from being a believable and interesting story, to something else entirely. It goes from feeling like an intersting world with lore you want to know more about, to a different kind of science-fiction experience. You go from being rather calm at the beginning, to seeing everything go horribly wrong as your whole world goes crashing into the great, big sea.Don't get me wrong, it is crazy good fun and a well developed mechanic... it just feels out of place. I liked the idea of using a non-lethal gun to shove my foes into areas they couldn't hit me, and also using it to solve puzzles, while also draining or adding more water to the area I was in so I could move onto the next section. The physics are incredible and the controls are intuitive, all in a world you can't help but be pulled into. It's one of those experiences that is like a bad B-movie but there's something oddly fascinating about it. It's not the violence, because this game isn't really that bloody -- in fact, there's really not much blood until you get firearms that actually shoot bullets instead of concussive blasts -- and it's not so much the thrills... it's the feeling of "what else could they throw at me?" I was constantly asking myself "What's next? What else is there? I want more."More is exactly what I got. The game only improves with each successive chapter, and then strange things happen... You get almost otherworldly powers. This is fun to use, creating towers of water, drowning your enemies or slowing down their bullets to a halt, but the water is mostly used for puzzle-solving. The puzzle-solving is definitely one of the better components of this game, but combat is actually interesting and fun. It feels almost like a cover-based shooter, but you know for sure that it's not what you're playing because you're not nearly as lethal as they are... at least... at first, you aren't. As things get more difficult, and you get more weapons, you think you have an understanding of just about everything. Then you get powers... Then you feel like you have a grasp on that and they throw more at you. There's so many good twists and turns in this game, it is surprisingly underrated. However... the ending is rather... anti-climactic. Altogether, a good experience.+ Physics+ A sense of vulnerability+ Puzzles+ Combat+ Puzzle combat?+ Environmental kills; including drowning, electrocution, and explosives+ Soundtrack+ Story+ B-movie feel+ Intense without the violence+ Collectables+ Somehow satisfied by the end of the game- Anti-climactic ending- Some parts where the story falls flat- Voice acting could have been better directed
