number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												Hydrophobia, a cross between adventure and third person shooter. The game starts on a giant ship which houses tonnes of people. You play as a mechanical engineer who is trying to foil the terorist attack on the vessel.The game is relatively cheap at $5 (I got it for about $1 at sale :D). The main selling point of the game is the water mechanics. You can control the flow of water to open paths and even defeat enemies. The water graphics are really good (it looks and moves fluidly). Now for the bad points. Although the water graphics are good, other models (ie. characters, environment) seem somewhat bland. The voice acting isn't that great either, nor is the story unfortunately. The biggest problem I had with the game were lag spikes. Alot of lag spikes. Although it's a single player only game, it lagged and even freezes (for a few minutes at a time) on me in several areas even after lowering all the graphical settings to bottom. I play games like retribution and crysis  fine with minimum lag, but this game struggles to run for some reason. The third person shooting is also clunky as the movement controls aren't great.Overall, the game does try to be unique with the water mechanics, but it doesn't make up the the under par graphics, story, controls and bugs. I haven't finished it (due to the bugs), but after spending 2 hours in it I'm not really compelled to play it. Save your money people.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
												I bought this game to test my new debit card for 0,49 euros back before refunds existed...I regret spending that money.This...is a very, very bad game. I wanted to beat the game for the sake of being able to give a review based on the complete game, but I just couldn't make myself finish it. In the hour and a half spent on the game, I finished around half the game judging by the collectibles and chapter select. It just isn't worth any more time.I am desperately trying to find something positive in this game. If I had to pick, I would say that for the time when this game came out, the water physics are pretty good. Other than that...First of all, apart from water, everything else looks bland and generic. Not only are the graphics bad, with human animations being some of the worst I've seen, but apart from fire and water, everything else is either grey, blue, yellow or red. During the time I spent with it, I never left generic sci-fi corridors which all look the same.There is a story, but the dialog and voice acting are so awful that I couldn't make myself listen to them. And even if I did, it is impossible to piece together what is going on. Somebody is attacking the station our protagonist lives on, for reasons I never understood, nor could get myself to care about. The characters are so bad and generic, there is some hint that the protagonist is special in some way but I didn't reach that point in the game, and I think that even if I did I wouldn't care.The pacing and gameplay are also very bad. In the time I played, I only had two enemy encounters, the rest was platforming and swimming. Not very challenging, and very boring with little to no challenge. There were a few puzzles, but those seem more like padding than actual gameplay mechanics. And the controls are terrible, often causing me to jump in a completely different direction from the one I wanted.All in all, don't buy this game, it isn't worth your time, nor your money.

												Despite the reviews that have averaged around 64/100, the game itself must be looked at not for its longevity or story.. It needs to be looked at for it's signature greatness: Realistic water physics! Seriously, for a indie title like this that was created by a handful of developers, it is very very hard to imagine why the hell many AAA title game developers with a extremely high budget can't pump out the same, if not better of a water-physics game! So simply put, if you don't understand what makes this so unique, here it is:The water is very dynamic, and uses Cosine trig functions as a basis for the water's modelling. The water uses many properties from real physics: Room 1 has lower water level, Room 2 has higher water level.. Door opens between the rooms, and Room 2's water flows into Room 1's water until it evens out.Even more exciting: When water flows into a room, waves will come through, pushing your player away, and the water smacks up against a wall them moves in the opposite direction. The water in this game can be manipulated too. If you shoot a glass window with a room full of water, the window will burst and in comes the massive amounts of water. The game is just pure awesome JUST because of the great water physics modelling. Everything else about this game is mediocre, and I can't justify paying full price ($15.00) for this game. I got it on sale and could justify the sale of ($7.00) or lower.

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 26, 2015
												This game is pretty poorly made and I had to run it on lowest with 800x600 resolution to get no lag, anything above that made it lag like crazy and my PC passes the requirements by far.I don´t know why, but I need to write kind of a full review on this even if nowhere near professional. I´ll try to keep spoilers out as much as possible for anyone that could care about the story.This game is super short, myself I beat it around 4 hours.Story: Some terrorists invade your home/ship/whatever (???), you try to escape and get powers because reasons. The game didn´t tell much that I understood, there´s 0 connection to the characters and why they are doing what they are doing. For example: why in the world would the main characters friend stay to risk his own life just to make really dumb jokes and being almost useless? Said friend is just gone later in the game and is never heard from ever again.Final boss is not explained why it´s there, the ending is just dumb and everything is just horribly cheesy.Gameplay: It´s a third person shooter with climbing. swimming and platforming. Sounds great, right? It´s not. The shooting is alright at best, but the platforming... oh god the platforming is bad. I found myself going climbing down instead of up, and sometimes just falling to my death because why not. The best part is the swimming. If there's anything good in this game, it´s the water. It would be the perfect swimming simulator if there wasn´t this little girls voice constantly giggling and screaming inaudible stuff. I get what it´s trying to do with the whole fear of drowning thing, but a little girls giggling only makes it annoying.Now the shooting. The shooting is pretty good, only one big flaw: the ai. The ai really loves to walk into you and shoot you until you are dead, but at least you get to kill stuff... in water.Graphics: The graphics look really nice even on lowest settings. Most people would tear their eyes out because they want super realistic graphics, but I say the graphics is alright in my book.The water isn´t ultra realistic, but it looks good enough. Probably don´t belong here, but I really liked that the water kept slowly rising instead of just stopping at a certain point... mmm, water.Audio: Wow. The voice acting is actually better than a certain bad game about motorcycles and revenge... at least they attempt to bring life to the voices instead of simply reading off a script... mostly. Water sounds? Sounds realistic enough. And that´s all that matters in this game. Water.Summary: If you enjoy swimming, drowning and shooting in third person then this is for you. I actually would recommend this game, despite the flaws I had some fun out of it and the cringy dialogue made me keep going to hear more bad lines. Worth the full price? Hell no. Wait for a price drop or a sale, then buy it.Also water.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2012
												I heard this game went through a lot of revision (or some similar version that was on consoles did?) but this game is one of those concept games with a LOT of promise and a serious lack of content.Game ran perfectly fine on highest settings (Radeon 6850 / Phenom II x6 / 8gb ram), no hiccups or glitches.  Controls were spot on except for a lack of ledge-hang button.  I craved the cover controls from Deus Ex Human Revolution (as the mechanics in this game are a little like that).Actual game stuff -- Many ammo types but only a few useful ones (default and EMP for the bossfight).  Combat was fine enough but enemies seemed to spawn out of corners or nooks a few times.  Platforming worked well.  Water powers difficult to control   The water mechanics worked well, but I wished the water pushed me around more, it doesn't quite feel real.The storyline is good, characters good, gameplay good... just NOT enough of it!  I finished this game in only a few hours, just a bit more than 3.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2015
												So my initial impressions of this game were that is was a fairly low budget production with some interesting ideas and good use of in game physics, particularly with regards to the water. Well worth a purchase in a sale for a 3-4 hour experience. However, that's when I got to Act 2 and the crashes began. The performance of this game divebombs after Act 1 on my system, with near constant framerate drops and frequent enough crashing to become intrusive, particularly prominent in an experience as short this. To add to this frustration, voice acting and subtitles began to desync and stutter the further into to game I progressed, the games conclusion is painfully lacking and the "Challenge Room" unlocked as post game content is quite frankly the worst and most shallow wave based horde mode I have ever experienced.I wanted to give this game a recommendation as at its best, it presents competent exploration and at the very least an average experience overall, but the simple facts of game instability and the bad taste left upon completion would make this dishonest.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
												I bought this game despite the negative reviews because I remember playing a demo for it a while back on Xbox Live. I remember enjoying the short demo, but it was too expensive at the time. I played the first 1 and a half acts....and I don't even really want to continue.The graphics are low quality for today's standards, so it isn't all that attractive. The graphics kind of give me a headache. And I am, by no means, a graphics buff.In addition, the controls and the camera are just...disorienting. I found myself getting a little dizzy, even after turning down the mouse sensitivity.And then the gameplay is frustrating. There were several times when I had no idea what to do. And that's not because the game doesn't hold your hand. It tells you exactly where to go next. It's just graphically not clear how to get there. I spent 15 minutes walking around a room because there was a place I needed to get to that I knew I should be able to get to by climbing the piping, but she wouldn't grab the pipe for no reason at all. I finally found out I needed to shoot out a wall and that the pipe I was trying to grab was just...not intended to be grabbed...It was slightly bigger than the pipes you use throughout the game, but they expected you to just ignore this path in favor of shooting a wall.I still think I'm going to finish the game, because I hate leaving games unfinished. I already spent an hour and  a half on the game, I may as well spend the second hour and a half to get the payoff. Because I know the gameplay and graphics aren't the strong points of this game. It must be the story, right?I'm dreading re-opening the game....I wouldn't wish this on anyone. Don't bother with this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												Overall: 7/10Graphics: 8/10Gameplay: 7/10Story: 6/10I know this game gets a bad rap for being short and having a lacking story, but I found it easy to get into the story and keep up.  It's something you have to pay attention to.  I didn't find the story really all that boring, I'm just disappointed that you don't get your powers until late in the game when they're a bit irrelevant.  (I'm so used to shooting my guns that I don't know if I'll use the powers much.)  I also liked that the main focus, water, had life to it.  It wasn't just something that was everywhere and utterly useless, you could actually use it to progress in the game.  Need to go up one level but no stairs/ladder/etc?  Can't go through a door because there is a fire right in front of it?   Shoot a wall and ride the flood.   Need to get to the next part of the story and don't feel like killing your way through a group of 10 guys?  You guessed it, OPEN THE FLOOD GATES AND SHOOT DOWN SOME POWER LINES.  Too many indie developers go for generic, popular themes such as the ever popular Zombie shooter or some post-apocalyptic world that has little to no back story as to how things happened (or it takes forever to know the full story).  It's refreshing that they did their own spin on a futuristic dying Earth where the problem was over-population and not some catastrophic apocolyptic event.  For $5($0.49 during steam sales), this game gives you your money's worth and 8 times out of 10 you'll enjoy playing this for a few hours.  I got this through a Humble Bundle, so I didn't pay more than $0.10 for it, therefore take what I say with a grain of salt.

If you're going to buy it, I would suggest getting it on sale. The story is kinda "meh", but I've seen worse. It seems like one of those games that's more about gameplay than story. Still, if you think it looks interesting, I'd say give it a shot.

												It was a good game. Great water effects (of course) and the story line was cliche (take out the bad guys while you're a girl in tight clothing) but it had a unique touch to it which I liked.The game was a bit buggy and in some instanses I didn't have a clue what to do because it wasn't defined well enough. But that doesn't bother me as much because all games have their flaws. But there were two things that set me off: for one, of course if you're on a ship taken over my terrorists, you're gonna see them. But what bugged me the most is I'm literally having a good time and I'm just about to reach the objective and then bullets start pelleting towards me from literal blind spots in the area. Of course the hallways and rooms that they had to protect were understandable but for God's sake I went into a hallway that was overflown (where there was no way to get air) and there were like three terrorists down there and it became really bothersome when they continued to respawn in one place in Act 3.The other thing that bugged me is that I thought this story was going to have a nice smooth ending where we stop the entire attack but the minute I walked into the last room - boom: boss fight. I like boss fights but in all honesty this game didn't seem like it would have one. It felt like a last minute thing that the creators just dug up. It probably wasn't - since it was a nice fight, but it wasn't needed. Like, I don't even know what I was fighting. Some gigantic futuristic ball of metal. It felt out of place and random, ya know? Others may think otherwise but I personally felt like it wasn't a good ending.I know I put that I would not reccomend this game but I do on some level because it is a fun game. Short game, as well, but fun. It just had some things that really ticked me off is all but the game itself was beautiful the storyline was good.
